rf.bayesian

Class Bayesian

  • java.lang.Object
    • rf.bayesian.Bayesian
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RelevanceFeedback

    public class Bayesian
extends java.lang.Object
implements RelevanceFeedback
    This class implements the Bayesian Query Shifting.
    Author:
    Chris Wendler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double[] expectationIrrelevant
      The expectated descriptor vector of the irrelevant images.
      private double[] expectationRelevant
      The expectated descriptor vector of the relevant images.
      private double scatterBetween
      Scatter between is the distance between the expectation vectors.
      private double scatterWithin
      Scatter within is the averaged deviation from the two expectation vectors of the image classes.
      private double sigmaSquare
      The approximation of the variance.
      private boolean useScatterSigma
      The expectated descriptor vector of the relevant images.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Bayesian()
      If you use the default constructor the approximation chosen for sigma is the product of scatterWithin and scatterBetween.
      Bayesian(boolean useScatterSigma)
      The boolean flag of the constructor denotes which approximation is used for sigma.

        Scatter within is the averaged deviation from the two expectation vectors of the image classes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bayesian

        public Bayesian()
        If you use the default constructor the approximation chosen for sigma is the product of scatterWithin and scatterBetween.

      • Bayesian

        public Bayesian(boolean useScatterSigma)
        The boolean flag of the constructor denotes which approximation is used for sigma.
        Parameters:
        useScatterSigma - if this is true sigmaSquare equals the product of scatterBetween and scatterWithin, else sigmaSquare is the average Variance of the positives and negatives.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateScatterWithin

        private double calculateScatterWithin(java.util.List<ImageContainer> positives,
                            java.util.List<ImageContainer> negatives,
                            double[] expectationsRelevant,
                            double[] expectationsIrrelevant,
                            DescriptorType type)
        Calculates the scatter within, which is necessary for the approximation of the Variance.
        Parameters:
        positives - is the list of positively marked images.
        negatives - is the list of negatively marked images.
        expectationsRelevant - is the expectation value of the relevant images.
        expectationsIrrelevant - is the expectation value of the irrelevant images.
        type - is the descriptor type which is considered for the calculation.
        Returns:
        the calculated value for scatter within.

      • calculateScatterBetween

        private double calculateScatterBetween(double[] expectationsRelevant,
                             double[] expectationsIrrelevant)
        Calculates the value scatter between which is used to approximate the variance.
        Parameters:
        expectationsRelevant - is the expectation value of the relevant images.
        expectationsIrrelevant - is the expectation value of the irrelevant images.
        Returns:
        the calculated value for scatter between.

      • calculateAverageVariance

        private double calculateAverageVariance(java.util.List<ImageContainer> positives,
                              java.util.List<ImageContainer> negatives,
                              double[] expectationsRelevant,
                              double[] expectationsIrrelevant,
                              DescriptorType type)
        Calculates a different approximation for the variance by adding up the variance of the relevant images with the variance of the irrelevant images.
        Parameters:
        positives - is the list of positively marked images.
        negatives - is the list of negatively marked images.
        expectationsRelevant - is the expectation value of the relevant images.
        expectationsIrrelevant - is the expectation value of the irrelevant images.
        type - is the descriptor type which is considered for the calculation.
        Returns:
        an approximation for the variance.

      • shiftQuery

        public ImageContainer shiftQuery(ImageContainer query,
                        DescriptorType type)
        Performs the query shifting.
        Parameters:
        query - the old query image.
        type - the type of descriptor which has to be considered.
        Returns:
        The new (shifted) query image is returned.

      • relevanceFeedbackIteration

        public java.util.List<ImageContainer> relevanceFeedbackIteration(Retriever retriever,
                                                        ImageContainer query,
                                                        DescriptorType type,
                                                        Metric metric,
                                                        java.util.List<ImageContainer> positives,
                                                        java.util.List<ImageContainer> negatives,
                                                        int resultAmount)
        Performs a relevance feedback iteration. Side effect: all the RF Methods add the positively and negatively marked images to the query Image object.
        Specified by:
        relevanceFeedbackIteration in interface RelevanceFeedback
        Parameters:
        retriever - the retriever which is used to search.
        query - the query image.
        type - the descriptortype which was used for the query.
        positives - the images marked as positive.
        negatives - the images marked as negative.
        resultAmount - the number of desired results.
        Returns:
        the results after considering the user feedback.
